DOCNAME: MARTINOVSKA v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a citizen of the former GPE who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant , together with CARDINAL other individuals , instituted civil proceedings against her employer , a company called PERSON ( “ the employer ” ) for payment of salary and other related allowances for the period of DATE to DATE .

On DATE ORG granted her claim ( and of the other claimants ) together with interest . On DATE ORG upheld the lower court ’s judgment . As stated by the applicant , the judgment was served on DATE , on an unspecified date .

On an unspecified date , the applicant requested ORG I to enforce the judgment ( предлог за извршување ) . On DATE it granted her request and ordered ORG ( “ the Bureau ” ) ( PERSON за платен промет ) to transfer from the employer ’s account the amount due to her . On DATE the applicant completed her application as requested by the court . However , the order was not enforced as there were no funds in the account .

On DATE the applicant requested the ORG to enforce her claim proposing another means of enforcement : an inventory , valuation and public sale of an employer ’s property ( the same property which was the subject - matter of the second set of proceedings ) . She requested the court to complete the enforcement by the proposed means only if her claim could not have been discharged by transferring the amount due to her from the employer ’s account .
On DATE the Skopje ORG forwarded the case - file to ORG , as court competent ratione loci .

In DATE the court requested the applicant to submit a certificate of title concerning the employer ’s property . It appears that in DATE she obtained a certificate of title and submitted it to the court .

On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant brought against the employer a compensation claim for payment of salary and other related allowances for DATE , after she had successfully challenged the lawfulness of her dismissal .
On DATE the ORG of First Instance partially granted her claim . On DATE ORG dismissed the employer ’s appeal and upheld the lower court ’s judgment .

On DATE the applicant requested the ORG to enforce the judgment by transferring the amount due to her from the employer ’s account into her account . On DATE the applicant completed her application submitting a copy of the judgment , as requested by the court .
On DATE the ORG granted the applicant ’s request and ordered the ORG to transfer the amount due to her from the employer ’s account .

On DATE the applicant proposed another means of enforcement , namely an inventory , valuation and public sale of an employer ’s property . It was sent to ORG with a request for forwarding the file to ORG as court competent ratione loci . On DATE the applicant submitted an addendum to the request .

On DATE ORG of First Instance refused the applicant ’s request for a charging order over the employer ’s property , as it had been the subject of other enforcement proceedings and sold to a third person on DATE . On DATE the creditor in those proceedings had taken possession of the property ( this decision became final on DATE ) .
On DATE the applicant appealed against the judgment before ORG ) .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the lower court ’s judgment .
The applicant did not request the court to enforce her claim against other assets nor did she propose other means of enforcement as specified by law .
The applicant ’s cases concerning both sets of proceedings were set to archive in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively .
On DATE the applicant requested ORG to join the CARDINAL sets of enforcement proceedings and to proceed only in respect to the employer ’s property , as its account reportedly had no funds .

On DATE the applicant repeated her request for joining the CARDINAL sets of enforcement proceedings . She also requested to have her enforcement proceedings joined with the proceedings of another creditor , PERSON , instituted against the employer .
On DATE the applicant submitted a corrected version of her request . On DATE the applicant repeated her request .
On CARDINAL and DATE , respectively , the applicant and PERSON requested the president of ORG and ORG to join their proceedings .
On DATE the ORG of First Instance informed the applicant and PERSON that on DATE the presiding judge had decided not to join the proceedings .
Section CARDINAL of LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) ( ORG за извршната постпка ) provides that enforcement and security proceedings are launched on creditor ’s request .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides the following means for enforcing judgment debts : ( i ) sale of movable property , ( ii ) sale of immovable property , ( iii ) transfer of a pecuniary claim , ( iv ) encashment of other proprietary rights , and ( v ) transfer of funds from an account managed by ORG , in accordance with the regulations .
In accordance with LAW , the courts are required to enforce judgment debts by the means and against the assets specified in the request for execution .

Section CARDINAL provides that a request for execution should specify : the creditor and debtor ; the final order ; the debtor ’s duty ; the means and assets for enforcement and other information necessary for completion of the enforcement .
In accordance with section CARDINAL § CARDINAL , the enforcement order is served on the creditor and the debtor . The dismissal of the request for execution is served only on the creditor .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that enforcement over immovable property is effected by recording the order in the register , obtaining a valuation of the property , selling it and settling the LOC claims from the proceeds of sale .

Section CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL of the LAW provides , inter alia , that in support of a request for a charging order over immovable property , the creditor should submit an extract from the public records , as evidence that the property is owned by the debtor .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW states that the court will not stay enforcement proceedings if there are no funds in the debtor ’s account managed by ORG . Instead , ORG is required to keep a record of the order and to make the transfer when there are funds in the account .
